comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
I like them both, but I don't want either of them as presidential candidates.
If Joe Biden is alive he will run again. He’s the only one who can beat Trump.
I like Pete - he is head and shoulders better than Harris in every way.  To be honest, I like him more than Biden too.

Can't see how the dnc can avoid a jungle primary if Biden doesn't run. If the dems try to pick someone using inside baseball and party politics again, it will not end well.   People are smarter than committees.
Pete needs to stand down here and let Kamala do her thing
You forget how sexist and racist Americans are.       Child.
Maybe Biden should get literally anything in his agenda passed.
Her allies are right, but why the fuck are her allies even talking about 2024 right now?
Presidental hopeful doesn't want other people to run? Well I never

First, no horse race, but if we must both would be catastrophic for the Democrats. Buttigieg is just the democratic Marco Rubio, a lot of words and a full head of hair. Harris didn't make it to Iowa last time and doesn't have anything to run on.

Harris isnt forced to run for president. I recommend that she doesn't. 

I'd prefer Elisabeth Warren, Katie Porter, Al Franken, Wendy Davis in that order. Michelle Obama will only ever get my vote if she even barely hints at a political future.

If she is afraid of competition - maybe she should not run.

Besides - why is she assuming Biden won't be the one running?

Why aren’t we looking at popular Dem governors instead?

Jay Inslee

Gavin Newsom

Michelle Lujan Grisham

Jared Polis

Phil Murphy

Inslee would roast Ron DeSantis in a debate and towers over him. We love him in Washington State. He’s handled COVID well and clobbered his helpless GOP opponent handily.
I don't want either of them.

Remember that Harris didn't make it to Iowa. Her campaign manager was her sister who didn't tell Harris the hard truths she needed to hear in order to succeed. I've been looking for Harris to get something going as VP but I'm not seeing it. I'm thinking it's open season in the 2024 primary.

Remember how "Her turn" worked last time?

Harris has less charisma than a dead armadillo, trying to push her in 2024 would be moronic.
They shouldn’t ignore the fact that AOC will be old enough to run in 2024.
Neither would be my choice
I hate this reporting so much. If they’re so scared, then she can drop out.

Harris was polling fifth in her own state in the 2020 Democratic primary before she realized the inevitable and dropped out.  As far as I can tell she's done nothing of note as VP.

She will be a sure loser if she runs in 2024.

Pete's last successful election was to mayor of a small city.  Give me a break.

Pushing either of them is a surefire way for a GOP win

Edit: Maybe Harris should push out a narcissistic documentary too
The obvious solution is that neither should run. Even better if they retire from politics entirely
Both of them suck.

Tough shit. There are millions of us who aren't going to vote for the prosecutor in the Democratic primary. Being VP doesn't change that. Meantime, who is planning to vote for the mayor of South Bend? 

Stupid breathless race horse journalism.
It's 3 years away. Let's chill with articles on the 2024 election ffs.
